meanings.definition: A early form of bicycle with pedals on the front wheel.
meanings.sent1: I saw a velocipede at the museum.
meanings.sent2: My grandfather used to ride a velocipede when he was young.
meanings.sent3: The velocipede in the antique shop looked like a fun way to travel.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination was a velocipede, propelling her through the world of stories.
meanings.sent5: The shiny velocipede gleamed under the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A vehicle with two or more wheels that is propelled by the rider pushing off the ground with their feet.
meanings.sent1: The children raced their velocipede down the street.
meanings.sent2: She learned to ride a velocipede in the park.
meanings.sent3: The velocipede race at the fair was quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: His determination was the fuel that drove his velocipede forward.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the velocipede wheels on the pavement echoed in the quiet neighborhood.
